perturbation.changed_text:
2. TERM. The term of the Franchise shall be twenty (20) years, commencing on January 1, 2016.

6. NOTICE. The term of this Franchise shall also be subject to earlier termination by Grantor, at any time, with or without cause.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the 'TERM' of the franchise. Section 2 initially states a fixed 20-year term. By appending to Section 6 that the Grantor can terminate the agreement 'at any time, with or without cause,' a conflict arises. This creates uncertainty about the actual duration of the franchise, as the Grantor's termination right effectively overrides the defined 20-year term. Is the term 20 years, or is it indefinite, subject to the Grantor's discretion? This contradiction could lead to disputes.

3. FRANCHISE FEE.
(a) Grantee shall pay to Grantor a Franchise Fee which shall be calculated pursuant to this Section. It is understood that
Grantee has or will enter into franchise agreements with the City of Roanoke (“Roanoke”) and the City of Salem (“Salem”) and the
Town of Vinton (“Vinton”) (Grantor, Roanoke and Salem being hereinafter sometimes collectively referred to as the “localities” and
singularly as a “locality”) with fee provisions identical to this one, and that the total annual Franchise Fee to be paid to the three
localities in aggregate is $98,196 for calendar year 2016 (“base year total annual Franchise Fee”). Grantor’s Franchise Fee shall
be a percentage share of the base year total annual Franchise Fee, which shall be determined on a pro rata basis according to its
percentage share of the total dollar value of Grantee’s gas sales occurring within the localities during the calendar year. For each
calendar year of the Franchise, each locality’s percentage share shall be determined by the following formula:
total dollar value of Grantee’s gas sales within
Locality’s percentage share = the Territorial Limits of the locality
total dollar value of Grantee’s gas sales in the three localities
For calendar year 2016, the Franchise Fee shall be paid to Grantor on or before March 31, 2017.

(b) Notwithstanding subsection (a), the Grantor reserves the right to adjust the Franchise Fee annually, at its sole discretion, based on prevailing economic conditions. Any such adjustment will be communicated to the Grantee at least 30 days prior to the start of the calendar year. The formula outlined in subsection (a) will serve as a guideline but is not binding.
perturbation.explanation: Section 3(a) lays out a precise formula for calculating the 'FRANCHISE FEE.' The added text in section 3(b) stating 'Notwithstanding subsection (a), the Grantor reserves the right to adjust the Franchise Fee annually, at its sole discretion, based on prevailing economic conditions,' introduces a significant contradiction. While 3(a) provides a seemingly objective calculation method, 3(b) gives the Grantor unilateral power to change the fee. This makes the fee calculation uncertain, as it is no longer solely determined by the formula but is subject to the Grantor's discretion. The mention of the formula in subsection (a) serving as a 'guideline' but is 'not binding' nullifies the initial explicit calculation.

perturbation.changed_text:
4. BUSINESS OFFICE. Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the
Territorial Limits of Grantor. Such office shall be open at least forty (40) hours per week for the conduct of business between
Grantee and its customers.

5. NONDISCRIMINATION. The requirement to maintain a business office is waived if the Grantee demonstrates that it can adequately serve its customers through alternative means, as determined solely by the Grantee.
perturbation.explanation: Section 4 mandates the Grantee to maintain a physical business office. The added sentence in Section 5, 'The requirement to maintain a business office is waived if the Grantee demonstrates that it can adequately serve its customers through alternative means, as determined solely by the Grantee,' directly contradicts this. The contradiction is that the Grantee 'shall' maintain an office versus the Grantee can 'waive' this requirement at their discretion. This makes the requirement for a business office ambiguous and unenforceable, as it is dependent on the Grantee's subjective assessment of its service capabilities.
